abstract: A very large segment of the over water, long haul passenger market, 31% of the passengers who provide 42% of the passenger revenue, offers a significant market for an advanced supersonic transport. This is for both the first class and full-fare economy passenger markets. The supersonic transport may be more competitive here in spite of lower costs of subsonic transports, as passenger preference is a more powerful variable than DOC. This latter fact was amply demonstrated in the late fifties when the jets completely replaced the reciprocating engine transports on most world routes, in spite of slightly higher fares.
title: Market trends

publications.publicationName: NASA.  Langley Res. Center  Proc. of the SCAR Conf., Pt. 2,

related.title: Proceedings of the SCAR Conference, part 2
